title: Rear Master Cylinder - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
The brake caliper will require removing and the pistons pushed out to back bleed the master cylinder as part of the brake bleeding procedure, see
Release the fixing and remove the rear ABS wheel speed sensor. Collect the shim from between the sensor and rear caliper carrier and discard the fixing.

body.name: Rear ABS wheel speed sensor fixing, chzq_1

body.body: Note the position of the rear brake caliper for installation.
Remove the brake caliper and carrier assembly.

body.name: Rear Caliper Carrier and Swinging Arm, L0311

body.body: Make sure no damage is made to the brake pad material when moving the brake pads.
Allowing the brake pads to come into contact with each other or sharp objects may cause the material to crack or break.
Damage to the brake pads may result in reduced braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.

Using a suitable flat metal plate approximately 2 mm thick and 30 to 50 mm wide (for example a gasket scraper) between the brake pads, pump the rear brake pedal slowly until the plate is held by the brake pads. Do not allow the pistons to fall out.
When disconnecting the brake hose from the master cylinder it is necessary to keep the open end of the hose above the height of the rear brake master cylinder.
Allowing the brake hose to fall below the rear brake master cylinder height will allow an excessive amount of air to enter into the brake system.
Trapped air may cause the brake lever to feel spongy and contribute to reduced braking efficiency.
The lower heel guard fixing also secures the master cylinder.
Remove the fixings securing the heel guard to the right hand control plate and remove the heel guard.
Temporarily refit the lower fixing to secure the master cylinder.

Noting its orientation for installation, disconnect the brake hose from the master cylinder, discard the washers and allow the brake fluid to drain from the master cylinder outlet into a suitable container.
Remove and discard the rear master cylinder reservoir fixing and support the reservoir.
Loosen the upper master cylinder fixing. Remove both fixings and detach the master cylinder from the right hand control plate.
Remove the lock nut, bolt and finisher securing the silencer to the right hand control plate.
Note the routing of the rear brake switch harness for installation.
Detach the rear brake switch harness from the clip on the rear master cylinder brake hose and disconnect its multiplug.
Remove the two fixings securing the right hand control plate to the frame and remove the control plate. Collect the flanged sleeves and grommets from the silencer mounting.

body.name: Silencer and control plate fixings, L0314

body.body: Note the position and orientation of the clevis pin and clip for installation.
Note the position and orientation of the brake switch and brake pedal return springs for installation.
Remove and discard the rear brake pedal pivot bolt.
Remove the clip and clevis pin at the lower end of the brake push rod and remove the master cylinder.

body.name: Rear brake pedal pivot bolt and clevis pin, L0315

body.body: Disconnect the reservoir hose from the master cylinder if required and collect any brake fluid.
